items: Dynamic typewriter effect on landing page hero — cycles through "LinkedIn" and "Substack" to showcase multi-platform support
Substack support — scrape and save Substack articles and notes with platform-specific content extraction
Custom-domain Substack detection — automatically identifies Substack sites that use custom domains (e.g., lennysnewsletter.com) by inspecting page HTML
Platform-specific badge colors — LinkedIn (blue), Substack (orange), Other (gray) with dark mode support
Smarter author extraction for Substack — filters out "Substack" as author, parses note profiles (@username format), and falls back to og:title parsing
LinkedIn content cleaning — prefers clean og:description over raw page text to prevent author bios from appearing in post content
Grid and list view toggle on dashboard — switch between card grid and compact list layouts
List view component with expandable content, inline metadata, and thumbnail previews
Content cleaning pipeline — multi-stage processing strips author bios, social engagement metadata (likes, comments, share buttons), and normalizes whitespace
Author extraction improvements — properly parses LinkedIn og:title pipe-delimited format and uses multiple fallback strategies
URL auto-scraping — paste a URL and automatically extract post content, images, and author info
Scrape preview in create dialog — "Fetch" button fills in content, image, and author fields before saving
Bulk import — upload CSV or JSON files to import multiple posts at once
Chrome extension — save LinkedIn posts directly from your feed with one click
Initial release of superBrain — your second brain for LinkedIn content
Save, organize, and search posts with AI-powered semantic search
Manual post creation with tags, author info, and URL tracking
AI search sidebar — ask natural language questions about your saved content
Favorite posts for quick access
Authentication via Replit sign-in
